title: How to Install Windows 95

steps.headline: Insert the Windows 95 installation disk.
Boot up your computer.
Wait for the screen message to appear.
steps.description: When this screen appears, press ↵ Enter.

steps.headline: Configure.
steps.description: If you haven't already allocated a partition to your hard drive, make sure 'Configure unallocated disk space' is highlighted and ↵ Enter.

steps.headline: Select whether you would like large disk support.
steps.description: This is a matter of personal preference but 'Yes' was chosen in this tutorial. This message may not come up if your hard drive is smaller than 512mb.

steps.headline: Ensure the Windows 95 Boot Disk is in Drive A and press ↵ Enter.
Press ↵ Enter to continue with the installation.
Click Continue to continue with the installation.
Accept the license agreement.
steps.description: It's a good idea to read the agreement so you know what you're agreeing to.

steps.headline: Click Next
Select where on your hard drive you want Windows 95 to install and click Next >.
steps.description: Normally it is best to choose where Windows recommends.

steps.headline: Select what kind of setup you would like and click Next >
steps.description: For this tutorial, 'Typical' was chosen.

steps.headline: Type in your product key and click Next >
steps.description: The product key should have come with your Windows 95 setup disks.

steps.headline: Type in your name and click Next >.
steps.description: It's not essential to put a company in

steps.headline: If you have any of the hardware, click the check boxes which relate to your hardware and click Next >.
steps.description: For this tutorial, none of the check boxes were selected.

steps.headline: Choose whether you want to install the most common components for Windows or to choose the components yourself and click Next >
steps.description: For this tutorial, 'Install the most common components' was selected.

steps.headline: Choose whether you want to create a startup disk or not and click Next >
steps.description: The startup disk is a disk which can be inserted into your computer should Windows fail to boot and can then repair or reinstall Windows. For this tutorial 'No' was selected.

steps.headline: Click Next
Remove any disks from their drives e.g.
steps.description: floppy disks as well as the installation disk and click Finish

steps.headline: If you get confronted with this error, please see Method 4 ' Fixing "Windows protection error"'
Click OK
Type in a Computer name and a Workgroup and click Close
steps.description: Computer description is not required.

steps.headline: Reinsert the Windows 95 installation disk and click OK
Ensure your date and time settings are correct and then click Close.
Decide whether you want to install a printer.
steps.description: If so click Next > otherwise choose Cancel (Cancel was chosen in this tutorial).

steps.headline: Remove any disks in your computer and click OK to restart your computer.
The Windows 95 installation is complete.
steps.description: Enjoy.

steps.headline: Click Start.
Click Shutdown
Ensure the 'Shut down the computer?'
steps.description: option is checked and then click Yes.

steps.headline: Firstly, got to http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/141402-windows-95-21ghz-cpu-limit-broken/
Scroll down until you see FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP and click this hyperlink to begin the download.
Click the little arrow next to FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP as shown in the picture and click Show in folder.
Right click the folder, and extract using the default Windows service by click Extract All... to a destination of your choosing.
steps.description: You can also use a 3rd party program such as 7-Zip.

steps.headline: Read the readme.
steps.description:
This is so you can decide which file you need to use:
FIX95CPU.ISO and FIX95CPU.IMA is for use in a virtual machine
FIX95CPU.ISO can be used to burn to a CD
FIX95CPU.EXE is for writing to a floppy disk

steps.headline: Make sure the file you want to use is in the appropriate format (e.g.
steps.description: a CD), insert it into your computer and boot the computer and press any key to continue when confronted with the message shown in the picture.

steps.headline: Decide whether you want to read the readme by press Y for Yes or N for No.
steps.description: No was selected here as the readme is exactly the same as the one in the zip folder.

steps.headline: When confronted with this message, press any key to continue.
steps.description: This will begin to fix the processor issues.

steps.headline: Press any key to restart the computer and remove the 'CD' from the computer.
steps.description: If you don't remove the 'CD', it will begin an endless loop into this setup screen.

tyn: Windows 95 installation disk and product key
Blank Floppy disk (not required, unless you want a startup disk)
Intel 80386DX CPU that runs at any speed
RAM: 8MB (while 4MB is the official recommendation, Windows 95 may not boot with that amount of RAM)
text:
Preparing for installation Insert the Windows 95 installation disk.  Boot up your computer.  Installation Wait for the screen message to appear. When this screen appears, press ↵ Enter. Configure. If you haven't already allocated a partition to your hard drive, make sure 'Configure unallocated disk space' is highlighted and ↵ Enter. Select whether you would like large disk support. This is a matter of personal preference but 'Yes' was chosen in this tutorial. This message may not come up if your hard drive is smaller than 512mb. Ensure the Windows 95 Boot Disk is in Drive A and press ↵ Enter.  Press ↵ Enter to continue with the installation.  Click Continue to continue with the installation.  Accept the license agreement. It's a good idea to read the agreement so you know what you're agreeing to. Click Next  Select where on your hard drive you want Windows 95 to install and click Next >. Normally it is best to choose where Windows recommends. Select what kind of setup you would like and click Next > For this tutorial, 'Typical' was chosen. Type in your product key and click Next > The product key should have come with your Windows 95 setup disks. Type in your name and click Next >. It's not essential to put a company in If you have any of the hardware, click the check boxes which relate to your hardware and click Next >. For this tutorial, none of the check boxes were selected. Choose whether you want to install the most common components for Windows or to choose the components yourself and click Next > For this tutorial, 'Install the most common components' was selected. Choose whether you want to create a startup disk or not and click Next > The startup disk is a disk which can be inserted into your computer should Windows fail to boot and can then repair or reinstall Windows. For this tutorial 'No' was selected. Click Next  Remove any disks from their drives e.g. floppy disks as well as the installation disk and click Finish If you get confronted with this error, please see Method 4 ' Fixing "Windows protection error"'  Click OK  Type in a Computer name and a Workgroup and click Close Computer description is not required. Reinsert the Windows 95 installation disk and click OK  Ensure your date and time settings are correct and then click Close.  Decide whether you want to install a printer. If so click Next > otherwise choose Cancel (Cancel was chosen in this tutorial). Remove any disks in your computer and click OK to restart your computer.  The Windows 95 installation is complete. Enjoy. Shutting down Click Start.  Click Shutdown  Ensure the 'Shut down the computer?' option is checked and then click Yes. Fixing "Windows protection error" Firstly, got to http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/141402-windows-95-21ghz-cpu-limit-broken/  Scroll down until you see FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP and click this hyperlink to begin the download.  Click the little arrow next to FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP as shown in the picture and click Show in folder.  Right click the folder, and extract using the default Windows service by click Extract All... to a destination of your choosing. You can also use a 3rd party program such as 7-Zip. Read the readme. This is so you can decide which file you need to use:
FIX95CPU.ISO and FIX95CPU.IMA is for use in a virtual machine
FIX95CPU.ISO can be used to burn to a CD
FIX95CPU.EXE is for writing to a floppy disk Make sure the file you want to use is in the appropriate format (e.g. a CD), insert it into your computer and boot the computer and press any key to continue when confronted with the message shown in the picture. Decide whether you want to read the readme by press Y for Yes or N for No. No was selected here as the readme is exactly the same as the one in the zip folder. When confronted with this message, press any key to continue. This will begin to fix the processor issues. Press any key to restart the computer and remove the 'CD' from the computer. If you don't remove the 'CD', it will begin an endless loop into this setup screen.
sentences: Preparing for installation Insert the Windows 95 installation disk.
Boot up your computer.
Installation Wait for the screen message to appear.
When this screen appears, press ↵ Enter.
Configure.
If you haven't already allocated a partition to your hard drive, make sure 'Configure unallocated disk space' is highlighted and ↵ Enter.
Select whether you would like large disk support.
This is a matter of personal preference but 'Yes' was chosen in this tutorial.
This message may not come up if your hard drive is smaller than 512mb.
Ensure the Windows 95 Boot Disk is in Drive A and press ↵ Enter.
Press ↵ Enter to continue with the installation.
Click Continue to continue with the installation.
Accept the license agreement.
It's a good idea to read the agreement so you know what you're agreeing to.
Click Next  Select where on your hard drive you want Windows 95 to install and click Next >.
Normally it is best to choose where Windows recommends.
Select what kind of setup you would like and click Next > For this tutorial, 'Typical' was chosen.
Type in your product key and click Next > The product key should have come with your Windows 95 setup disks.
Type in your name and click Next >.
It's not essential to put a company in If you have any of the hardware, click the check boxes which relate to your hardware and click Next >.
For this tutorial, none of the check boxes were selected.
Choose whether you want to install the most common components for Windows or to choose the components yourself and click Next > For this tutorial, 'Install the most common components' was selected.

Choose whether you want to create a startup disk or not and click Next > The startup disk is a disk which can be inserted into your computer should Windows fail to boot and can then repair or reinstall Windows.
For this tutorial 'No' was selected.
Click Next  Remove any disks from their drives e.g.

floppy disks as well as the installation disk and click Finish If you get confronted with this error, please see Method 4 ' Fixing "Windows protection error"'  Click OK  Type in a Computer name and a Workgroup and click Close Computer description is not required.
Reinsert the Windows 95 installation disk and click OK  Ensure your date and time settings are correct and then click Close.
Decide whether you want to install a printer.
If so click Next > otherwise choose Cancel (Cancel was chosen in this tutorial).
Remove any disks in your computer and click OK to restart your computer.
The Windows 95 installation is complete.
Enjoy.
Shutting down Click Start.
Click Shutdown  Ensure the 'Shut down the computer?'
option is checked and then click Yes.

Fixing "Windows protection error" Firstly, got to http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/141402-windows-95-21ghz-cpu-limit-broken/  Scroll down until you see FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP and click this hyperlink to begin the download.
Click the little arrow next to FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP as shown in the picture and click Show in folder.
Right click the folder, and extract using the default Windows service by click Extract All... to a destination of your choosing.
You can also use a 3rd party program such as 7-Zip.
Read the readme.

This is so you can decide which file you need to use:
FIX95CPU.ISO and FIX95CPU.IMA is for use in a virtual machine
FIX95CPU.ISO can be used to burn to a CD
FIX95CPU.EXE is for writing to a floppy disk Make sure the file you want to use is in the appropriate format (e.g.
a CD), insert it into your computer and boot the computer and press any key to continue when confronted with the message shown in the picture.
Decide whether you want to read the readme by press Y for Yes or N for No.
No was selected here as the readme is exactly the same as the one in the zip folder.
When confronted with this message, press any key to continue.
This will begin to fix the processor issues.
Press any key to restart the computer and remove the 'CD' from the computer.
If you don't remove the 'CD', it will begin an endless loop into this setup screen.
